intro: Cupania canescens, commonly known as the hairy cupania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland areas. Cupania canescens is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
